description.narrative: The Tuvalu Education Support Program initiative provides support to UNICEFs Achieving Education for All. The program is an education sector support program developed by UNICEF in consultation with the Ministry of Education in Tuvalu to improve the quality of education and learning outcomes of over 3000 school children in Tuvalu which accounts for 30% of the total population of Tuvalu. It is a two phase program: Phase 1 focusing on research and scoping, technical and provision of teacher training; and Phase 2 focusing on actual implementation of targeted interventions. The program will benefit 18 Early Childhood Education Centres (ECCE), 10 primary schools and 2 secondary schools (one on the mainland Funafuti and the other on the outer island of Vaitupu). The program supports schools to implement a whole school approach to increase learning outcomes of Tuvalu children.
